ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English to morrow, from Old English tō morgne 'on the morrow,' from tō 'to' + morgne, dative of morgen 'morning.'

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在今天之后的那一天；明天。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I will meet you tomorrow morning.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我明天早上会和你见面。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 今天之后的那一天；明天。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The future; future time or prospects.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We need to plan for tomorrow and the challenges it brings.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们需要为明天及其带来的挑战做计划。
